alert.note: Alert for Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 23 at 7:49AM CDT until August 23 at 1:24PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Rio Grande At Foster Ranch affecting Val Verde County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Foster Ranch. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, (4.6 meters), moderate lowland flooding into the right flood plain floods campsites below Dryden to Amistad Reservoir. Turbulence is very dangerous for swimmers, tubers and canoeists. Livestock are trapped in low areas of the channel and banks and potentially can drown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...Moderate flooding is forecast, with the river falling below minor flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.9 feet on 10/09/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Rio Grande Foster Ranc 14.0 15.0 Wed 7 am CDT 11.6 3.1 2.0 &&
info.instruction: To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 130 PM CDT.
